content:
C. church at Tarsus 
D. Christians in Rome. 
 
45. The Jerusalem Council sent a group of four, with a letter 
to Antioch. At the end of their mission, which of the 
following remained behind in Antioch? 
A. Judas and Silas 
B. Silas and Paul 
C. Paul and Barnabas 
D. Barnabas and Judas 
 
46. “They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men 
who are Roman citizens, and have thrown us into 
prison; and do they now cast us out secretly?. . .” This 
experience of Paul was in 
A. Athens   B. Jerusalem C.   Philippi    D. Caesarea. 
 
47. Paul purified himself in theTemple after the third missionary 
journey because he was 
A. unclean 
B. under vow 
C. afraid of the Jews 
D. advised to do so by the elders. 
 
48. During Paul’s trial by the Tribunal, he brought a division 
between the Pharisees and Sadduccees by mentioning 
the issue of 
A. the Resurrection 
B. faith in God through Jesus 
C. the miracle of God 
D. the judgment 
 
49. On the Island of Malta, Paul healed a man who was 
A. born blind 
B. deaf and dumb 
C. lame from birth 
D. sick with dysentery. 
 
50. “Your blood is upon your heads! I am innocent. From 
now on I will go to the Gentiles.” The above statement 
was made by 
A. Jesus B. Paul C. Peter D. James. 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1992  
 
1. What was upon the face of the deep on the first day of 
creation? 
A. Light    B.   Cloud   C.  Water D. Darkness 
 
2. “Let there be lights I the firmament of the heavens to 
separated the day from the night …” 
This statement was made by God on the 
A. third day B. fourth day 
C. fifth day D. sixth day 
 
3. The story of the Fall teaches that 
A. man was made in the image of God 
B. it is a sin to disobey God 
C. Adam was less guilty than Eve 
D. God created man naked. 
 
4. ‘On that day all the fountains of the great deep burst 
forth and the windows of the heavens were opened. 
The result of this was a 
A. great earthquake B. heavy rainfall 
C. consuming fire    D. violent wind. 
 
5. “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would 
suckle children?…” 
A. Ishmael B. Sarah 
C. God D. Hagar. 
 
6. The quotation, “Let me not look upon the death of the 
child” comes form the story about 
A. Solomon and the two harlots 
B. the expulsion of Hagar and Ishmael 
C. Moses when hewas placed on thebank of the Nile 
D. Bathsheba and David’s illegitimate child. 
 
7. Joseph’s dream about his future leadership of his 
brothers was fulfilled when he became 
A. an overseer of Potiphar’s house 
B. an interpreter of dreams 
C. an influential prisoner 
D. the second in command of Pharaoh, 
 
8. The children of Israel cried out to God for help in Egypt 
because  
A. their male children were killed 
B. they were hungry and overworked 
C. they were in bondage 
D. Moses failed to look after them., 
 
9. “What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go 
from serving us?” 
The above statement was made by 
A. the Egyptian soldiers 
B. the Egyptian magicians 
C. the Cananites in the wilderness 
D. Pharaoh and his servants. 
 
10. The manna which the Israelites left till the morning in 
disobedience to God. 
A. bred worms and changed colour 
B. melted and bred worms 
C. bred worms and became foul 
D. melted and became foul, 
 
11 God gave the ten commandments to the people of 
Israel because He 
A. is a jealous God 
B. wanted their days to be long 
C. redeemed them from slavery in Egypt 
D. frowned at those who took His Name in 
vain. 
 
12. “…Choose this day whom you will serve, … as for me 
and my house, we will serve the LORD.” 
The Israelites’ response to the above statement is ‘…we 
A. also will serve the LORD, for He is our God’ 
B. cannot serve the LORD, for He is a holy God’
